citation.article-title: Paraoerskovia marina gen. nov., sp. nov., an actinobacterium isolated from marine sediment
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Paraoerskovia (Pa.ra.oer.sko′vi.a. Gr. prep. para beside; N.L. fem. n. Oerskovia a bacterial genus name; N.L. fem. n. Paraoerskovia beside or close to Oerskovia).
Cells stain Gram-positive and are non-motile, facultatively anaerobic rods.
Major fatty acids are ai-C15 : 0, C16 : 0, ai-C17 : 0 and C18 : 0.
The interpeptide bridge contains l-serine and d-glutamic acid.
The cell wall is A4α type with acetylated muramic acid residues.
The only polar lipid is phosphatidylglycerol.
The major quinone is menaquinone MK-9(H4).
The G+C content of the DNA of the type strain of the type species is 70 mol%.
The type species is Paraoerskovia marina.
